result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant in custody.    
State moves to dismiss and read in this charge, the defendant entered pleas in Case Nos. 16 CF 72, 16 CF 277 and 18 CF 6.   Motion granted.   
$1,500.00 cash bail applied on Case 16 CF 72.    
Minutes.

Copy filed.
Plea hearing on September 10, 2019 at 10:00 am.

Writ of Habeas Corpus Ad Prosequendum and Order to Sheriff to transport defendant for a plea date on 07-25-19 at 3:00 p.m. in Branch 3.
Copy filed.

Defendant in custody on WRIT.
Attorney Vanells is still reviewing discovery.  
Parties are making progress on resolving all cases.
Status conference/plea date is set for 07-25-19 at 3:00 p.m.
Minutes.
Plea date on June 21, 2019 at 11:00 am.
Brian Van Ells, through public defender.

from Public Defender to Judge Dewane re: inability to find counsel to represent defendant.

(correcting the condition)

ADDRESS INFO for Thomas L. KILLIAN
Current: Manitowoc County Jail, Manitowoc, WI 54220 United States  (Effective: 03-12-2019)
Prior: 1351 Ontario Road, Green Bay, WI 54311 United States
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

BAIL HEARING -
Defendant in custody on bench warrant and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The matter is continued for a plea date on 03-29-19 at 9:30 a.m. in Branch 3.  The $1,500.00 cash bail previously furnished is modified to an additional $2,000.00 cash, for a total of $3,500.00 cash bail on the file with the condition that he have no contact with Kwik Trip at 1137 S. 10th Street, Manitowoc, WI.  Additional $2,000.00 cash bail not furnished and the defendant is remanded into custody. Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
Bench warrant with service of officer thereon.
Minutes.
Warrant served.
Motion to Authorize Counsel of Record to Withdraw.
Letter from Atty. Hoff to Judge Rohrer re: withdrawal as counsel.

The defendant failed to appear for a plea date.
Attorney Prost indicates that she has checked the system and is shows the defendant is no longer in custody.
Attorney Hoff has had no contact with him.
The State requests warrant but asks that the cash bail not be forfeited.  There is significant restitution and the State would like it to be used to pay that.
The Court authorizes warrant and will not order forfeiture of bail at this time.
Minutes.
